rComments: Eva assigns A LOT of reading, but you can get away with not reading by taking good lecture notes. I'd recommend taking a laptop bc she covers through a lot of material very quickly. Takes attendance. 2 essays & 1 final. Essays were somewhat challenging but totally doable if you keep up with material. Final is okay & you get a cheat sheet

Took this class 'cause I was interested in the subject. Sort of hurt my soul to sit through it for the quarter. To take in so much information about politics without anyone (teacher or students) seeming to move towards any new insights was- difficult. Kinda like a microcosm for politics as a whole in the country.

Eva Bertram just may be the reason I am the person I am today.  She is truly remarkable and your world will be better if you take a class with her.  Her way of "unpacking" often complex, and controversial topics is so even-head, thorough, and inspiring. She expects a lot, but putting in the time to engage in the material is more than worth it!

Overall, Professor Bertram is really great and she knows her subject well. She is a very intelligent individual and the subject, American Politics, was interesting to learn about. Sometimes class could get boring because she repeated a lot of things that were in the readings, but overall I really did enjoy this class.

Not a politics major but I loved the class, Bertram is an INCREDIBLE lecturer. She gets the point across, repeats herself without making it tedious, and consistently checks in with the class to make sure everything is clear. She is also happy to help anyone who needs it.
Organized, articulate and engaging. Politics is my least favorite subject but she makes it so intriguing.

Extremely passionate, engaging, and communicative. Knows what she is talking about and how to get you to understand it. Lectures are dense and assignments are tough, but definitely learned a ton in her class. Best professor I have had at UC, highly recommend.

Professor Bertram is awesome! Definitely knows her material and gives specific examples to enhance the readings. A lot of reading for an upper-divison course, but well worth it. One reading response due each week (200-300 words), an in-class essay mid-term, and a final essay to turn in. Highly recommend taking a course with her!

The best politics professor in Santa Cruz hands down. She is the most articulate and concise professor I've had. She is very knowledgeable about her subject and easy to talk to. There is a lot of reading required, but she goes over it really well. One midterm, and one final paper, and weekly reading responses. I recommend her highly.

Prof. Bertram is an incredible no BS lady. Her class is demanding, but entirely worth it. She makes you think and really gets you involved in the subject. Make sure you do the readings and take good notes (the midterm is open note). HIGHLY recommend Eva - she's super duper rad.

Eva is incredible. The 2 essays she assigns are hardcore and that's what you'll need the readings [of which there are an insane amount] for. The final, which is open note and you get a study guide for- can be completed perfectly with information only from her lectures. Bring a computer to class because no one can write  that fast. GO TO CLASS.
Great teacher, has a knack for sparking interest in her subject. Work is fair, and although there is a lot of reading, it is generally very interesting while providing a bipartisan view.

I took 25, 120C and 122 with her; they were all fantastic. She is crystal clear, and she made me passionate about American labor policy. I'm taking my senior seminar with her and I can't wait. Her tests aren't terribly easy, but if you read and attend section (mandatory) you'll be fine. Amazing professor, take every class you can with her.

Very interesting topic but be prepared for hurt wrists because she talks really fast and gives you incredible amounts of info each lecture. Kinda overwhelming but overall class is fun. 2 take home midterms and in class final essay.

She is friendly and cares about what people have to say in her class. She is a very nice person and her lectures are interesting, but she gives an unbearable load of reading before each class! It's as if everyone only takes ONE class. If you want to be able to get a few hours of sleep and/or have a social life DON'T TAKE HER.

I LOVED THIS CLASS!!!! Eva is fantastic...she is extremely smart and helpful, passionate about her subject, and very approachable and available for her students. I liked her so much I chose her to be my department faculty advisor...Take her classes!!!!!

I thought I was going to hate this class, but Eva makes it very interesting.Her lectures are easy to follow and she speaks at a speed that makes notetaking easy.There is a LOT of reading and it can be hard to stay caught up on. Her papers require critical thinking, but as long as you have good reasons for what you write, you'll do fine.Great teache

Amazing lecturer, so passionate about her subjects.  Very helpful in office hours.  A decent amount of reading, but it's manageable and she helps you through it. Papers were challenging (in a good way).  Plus she's totally adorable when she gets all excited about politics.

Prof. was very easy to understand and very patient. Smart, well versed in the topic. Most helpful professor I've run into at UCSC. Great easy to understand teaching style, very hands on. Reading intensive, but doesn't MAKE you speak if you don't want to. Open to all comments, questions. Doesn't make you feel stupid.

Rock awesome. Favorite class I've taken at UCSC so far. Lectures are engaging, and she speaks very clearly, repeating things several times so everyone gets them. I highly reccomend this class to anyone interested in Politics or just anyone interested in knowing why America has some fo the laws we do.

Eva puts an outline on the board, and structures her lectures so that they follow this outline. It is very easy to take notes. She goes over the important things two or three times to make sure you get them. The class is really interesting and she's an excellent teacher.

Great class with a great professor.  Her lectures are very clear and easy to understand.  The subject material starts off a bit uninteresting, but over time the class becomes very engaging.  I would recommend this class and professor to anyone with an interest in American politics.

Eva is the best prof I have met on campus. Her objective is to teach not to bust your balls. Her lectures are organized and very clear but she still challenges her students and makes them think their way through the course. Very knowledgable and stimulating. to top it off she is very approachable and helpful face to face
eva is amazing. Her lectures are great and interesting and her class made me become a politics major.  She's also very helpful if you meet with her one on one.

One of the best professors at UCSC!  Her lectures are sooo interesting and the open-note final was great!  Very helpful and enthusiastic at her office hours!  However, her written assignments were a little challenging.

Lectures were VERY organized and clear. She always made sure the class was understanding the material. Course gave a history of US econ policy from the beginning to the present. Very informing. I learned a lot and took a hell of a lot of notes because her lectures are so filled with info.
Eva is the best prof. I've taken in the department. Her lectures are actually entertaining; very engaging. I wouldn't say the class is 'easy', but it's challenging in a good way. Highly recomended!!!

Very easy to talk to, helpful, and clear.  Teaches the material so objectively you'll wonder where she stands on the issues.  However, if you don't really want to know the full, explicit details of how the welfare state was developed in America, the 120C class won't be very interesting.

State and Cap is one of my favorite classes, and the fact that Eva and my TA were really hot made a huge difference for me.  She's a history and politics NUT (her words) which made the class interesting and engaging.  Not only did she have immense knowledge, but she is a total hottie and her hand movements accentuate her lectures.

One of the best classes I've ever taken at UCSC. Eva knows soooo much and shares it with her students in an interesting, fun environment. Her lectures are great - not boring, not yourt ypical politics class. She's very helpful and answers lots of questions. The work is not that difficult.

Eva prepares and displays her lectures very well and very clearly. The class can be boring at times. There are a lot of note taking though. The class only had 2 essays and a final (which she provided a study guide for) I liked Eva so much that I made her my academic advisor for Politics. Easy class.

She is seriously such a nice lady totally willing to help out. Make yourself noticed, answer questions and go to section, you dont have to do all the reading but enough to write the two essays don't get too far behind. Final was open notes and she gives lectures that are easy to take notes.

This is a HARD class, it covers a great deal of material. Professor is very helpful! I enjoyed the class, interesting information. VERY boring reading. Study guide greatly prepared me for the final. Lectures can be boring.

People are so uninformed, that is why it is ridiculous if you DONT take this class. The Information is really interesting and she brings a lot of clarity when you attend class. She describes and explains things really well, so it is easy to gain really good skills for debating and understanding.

She was a great teacher: it was very important to hear that students understood, and was very approachable as a result. The material covered can be daunting, so attending class is crucial but I learned so much. If you're a serious politics student, taker her class. If you're a slacker, don't bother.

She was a great teacher for this class. While it is true that she uses no visuals, she brings much enthusiasm to class and knows her stuff. The class I had with her was great at talking about U.S. economic policy + some interesting political history.

Eva's class is pretty boring. Be prepared to take a ton of notes. She also is 5-10 minutes late for every class. She uses no visuals for her lectures and recites an outline. The books as well as the section will help you succeed.
